results.title: Doctors' orders
results.creator_credit: Colin Richards and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
After the publication of a report on prescribing in general practice, the program looks at the reasons for over-prescribing and talks to several general practitioners who feel they are being pressurised by both patients and drug companies into this expensive and potentially dangerous situation.
results.description:

results.title: Tip of the iceberg
results.creator_credit: Steve Morrison and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”
The problem of toxic industrial waste poses environmental problems around the world. This film investigates the dangers of the dumping of tons of toxic waste on an industrial tip near the Avon Age fortress of Sutton Walls, Hertfordshire, and near farmland in Matlock, Derbyshire.
results.description:

results.title: Trial 1001
results.creator_credit: David Boulton and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”
Trade unions are illegal in Spain. A meeting had been arranged in a monastery, but ten men were brutally arrested as they arrived. Their relations describe the conditions of Franco’s dictatorship and the humiliation the men undergo in fighting for a basic human right.

results.title: Lucky
results.creator_credit: John Goldschmidt and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
A boy of 18 re-enacts the way he left his home in Devon and went to London, without money but with high hopes. There he keeps alive cadging and stealing. He takes drugs and is eventually taken to hospital after collapsing on the street. Following this, he is put in touch with the Department of Social Security who help in his rehabilitation.

results.title: Living dangerously
results.creator_credit: Alan Segal and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Reports on the explosion of a chemical factory in Seveso, Italy and the effects of the extremely toxic dust, dioxin, that was released into the atmosphere. The substance dioxin is contained in commercial weedkillers freely available in the United Kingdom.

results.title: Learning to lose
results.creator_credit: David Mills and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Looks at criticism of the English educational system which maintains that its emphasis on theory over practical skills leaves students less employable. Shows some alternative programs which have succeeded.

results.title: Home help (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Stephen Segaller and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Brindle House in Cheshire treats people with acute psychiatric problems in an informal atmosphere, as out-patients. The staff believe that by being more accessible they are able to intervene before patients reach a critical stage. They also believe that the process of recovery is aided if the patient can remain within the community among family and friends.

Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: Do you mind if I smoke?
results.creator_credit: Sue Woodford and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Investigates the dangers of passive smoking, ie the smoke inhaled by a non-smoker from cigarettes left burning in an ashtray or in someone’s hand. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.

results.title: The Demonstration
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
An award-winning episode of the ‘World in Action’ series observing the mass protest at the U.S. embassy in London against the bombing of North Vietnam. Interviews students travelling to the rally, police preparing for the confrontation and members of the public expressing their support or opposition to the event. Captures the violent clashes between police and the crowd and records the media coverage that was transmitted by American reporters.
results.description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
An award-winning episode of the ‘World in Action’ series observing the mass protest at the U.S. embassy in London against the bombing of North Vietnam. Interviews students travelling to the rally, police preparing for the confrontation and members of the public expressing their support or opposition to the event. Captures the violent clashes between police and the crowd and records the media coverage that was transmitted by American reporters.
